ions in the .cxml file, should I enclode them in double quotes or not?

 Matteo

> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com , "Ko, Lauren" wrote:
>=
 >
> > Hi Matteo,
> > One possibility for why you are still crawling images=
 is where you placed that MatchesListRegexDecideRule in your decide rule se=
quence. Heritrix goes through the set of rules in order and for each rule s=
ets the status of the URI being tested to ACCEPT, REJECT, or PASS. At the e=
nd of the decide rules, the status in place is the one used, so even if you=
r MatchesListRegexDecideRule rejects the URI, a later rule may change that =
status to ACCEPT. For example, your regex might rule out the URI, but if af=
ter that rule you have a TransclusionDecideRule, that "accepts any URI whos=
e path-from-seed ends in at least one non-navlink hop" (https://webarchive.=
jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Configuring+Crawl+Scope+Using+DecideRules) a=
nd is generally used to accept embedded content such as images and videos n=
o matter the URI pattern, the URI would be ruled back in to acceptance. You=
 could try moving your MatchesListRegexDecideRule lower in the chain of rul=
es and see if that helps.
> >
> > Lauren Ko
> > Web Archiving Programmer
> =
> UNT Libraries
> > ________________________________________
> > From: arch=
ive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com ] on behalf of=
 matteo.ceccarello@ [matteo.ceccarello@]
> > Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 201=
3 6:26 AM

awler] [Heritrix 3] exclude images, videos and archives from being crawled
=
> >
> > Hi all, we are trying to exclude images, videos and archives from t=
he set of URIs being crawled with a MatchesListRegexDecideRule:
> >
> >
> >=

> >
> >
> >
> >
> > ".*\.(jpeg|jpg|png|tiff|gif)$"
> >
> > ".*\.(mpg|webm|=
ogg|flv)$"
> >
> > ".*\.(mp3|oga|wav)$"
> >
> > ".*\.(iso|tar|gz|zip|rar|ex=
e)$"
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > However this doesn' seem to work: images still app=
ear in the crawl log. Does someone have any suggestion on why this happens?=

> >
> > Thank you very much
> >
> > Matteo
